urls.title: Welcome! You are invited to join a webinar: The Hot House: Panel Discussion. After registering, you will receive a confirmation email about joining the webinar.
urls.description: The Hot House, a development lab for scripted TV and film projects about climate change, will open for submissions on December 1st. Have you thought about writing a script addressing climate change? Join us for a panel event with screenwriter Richie Mehta (Amal, Siddharth, Delhi Crime), BFI Editor at Large Lizzie Francke and Climate Spring director Lucy Stone where they will be discussing the importance of storytelling to combat the climate crisis. The development lab, hosted by BBC, BFI and Climate Spring, offers the opportunity for shortlisted writers to have three months of one on one support to develop their ideas, and to pitch for development funding from Climate Spring. Join us on Wednesday 23rd November, 16:00-17:30 for an online panel event. Learn more about writing for climate change and be the first to find out more about what the Hot House development lab will offer.

urls.title: Meet the BFI NETWORK Insight Participants
urls.description: We are thrilled to announce the 12 producers selected for BFI NETWORK's inaugural Insight emerging producer programme. Supported by the BFI with National Lottery funding, the new nine-month programme is designed to provide vital training and professional development support for emerging producers taking serious steps towards their debut feature and growing sustainable, creative companies.

urls.title: The Short Film Toolkit | British Council
urls.description: A major new free-to-access short film toolkit designed to help navigate your route into the film industry, and your film's journey out into the world.

tweets.text: It's live! We've made an essential all-singing free-to-access Short Film Toolkit with our friends @BAFTA @bfinetwork  - designed to help navigate your route into the film industry, and your film's journey out into the world. https://t.co/ObvLVjPTQm

📢Calling all short filmmakers! We’ve partnered with the @BritishCouncil and @BFINETWORK to create The Short Film Toolkit. This vital resource features everything you need to know about getting your film made and seen 👉https://t.co/7t1fOdYxtx https://t.co/biQsg16ZvZ

tweets.text:
Our annual Open Call script submission window opens tomorrow! The deadline is Weds 7th Dec at noon. 

Any questions? We're running the first of a series of drop-ins tomorrow at 12.30-1pm. No need to book just use the link to join in. Full details here >>> https://t.co/aBPr00s9gu

Congratulations to the brilliant Kerrie Hayes!

#NationalLottery #BIFA2022 https://t.co/XREkan1N41

urls.title: The Grierson Trust - We're hiring: Training Programmes Coordinator
urls.description: The Grierson Trust is appointing a new part-time Training Programmes Coordinator. Supporting the Director of Training Programmes, t he new team member will be responsible coordinating various aspects of Grierson DocLab talent initiatives. This is an exciting opportunity for an individual who is passionate about factual TV and documentary and supporting new and progressing talent. Reporting to: Director of Training Programmes Other key internal stakeholders: Awards and Administrative Assistant, PR

tweets.text:

Part-time, flexible hrs & remote with some travel, find out more: https://t.co/VOK1D3aSOg https://t.co/BY7snRng1i

urls.title: BFI Film Academy Art Department Camp – Calling The Shots
urls.description: It’s the art department! And there are so many roles to choose from… whether you’re interested in production design, art direction, or have a talent for set decoration, storyboarding or props – the BFI Film Academy Art Department Camp is a great place to start! Start your film career journey at the BFI Film Academy Art Department Camp! The BFI Film Academy Art Department Camp is a week-long residential programme based in Bristol, led by Martha Baines (Beauty and the Beast, People Just Do Nothing and The

tweets.text:
Aged 16-19?
Have a knack for crafting and making things?
Want to use those skills on set?

🎨 The specialist Art Department @BFIFilmAcademy course is for you!

Find out more and sign up ⬇️
https://t.co/M5f7WvDY2t https://t.co/lbxRtZVfRo

urls.title: Welcome! You are invited to join a webinar: BFI Film Academy Lab: Music Documentaries. After registering, you will receive a confirmation email about joining the webinar.
urls.description: This month we quiz Doc'n Roll Film Festival’s Colm Forde and Vanessa Lobon-Garcia about the power of music documentaries to attract young audiences and create unique social events. In this session, they will share their passion for discovering under-the-radar music documentaries and share their experience of finding a niche in the film festival market and growing the distribution, sales and consulting side to their business. In this session, Vanessa and Colm will share their career story and discuss some of the ways you can develop a USP (unique selling point) for your film festival or screenings, along with tips and advice for programming music documentaries and working with under-the-radar filmmakers. Doc'n Roll will be in conversation with Uche Odoh, YFP Presenter, Filmmaker and Photographer. The session will be hosted by Julia Andrews-Clifford who is the YFP NETWORK Manager where she connects YFPs and cinema venues across the region through professional development and events. BFI

tweets.text:
For @filmhubse’s next online Lab they’ll be chatting with @docnrollfest about how you can develop a USP for your film screenings, along with tips and advice for programming music documentaries and working with under-the-radar filmmakers.

Register now: https://t.co/YVtQQs526t https://t.co/3gl5CL1h2D

urls.title: New short films glow up through Beacons scheme | Ffilm Cymru
urls.description: Ffilm Cymru Wales has selected twelve new short films to be developed through their Beacons scheme, supported by BBC Cymru Wales and BFI NETWORK with funding from the National Lottery. Beacons shines a light on Welsh talent, supporting emerging filmmakers from Wales to make a cinematic calling card with funding, training, mentoring and advice. This latest slate of short films showcases the diverse variety of stories, voices and talent of Wales across animation, documentary and live-action fiction.

tweets.text: We’ve selected 12 new short films to be developed through our @BFINETWORKWales #Beacons scheme, supported by @BBCWales & @bfinetwork with funding from the #NationalLottery. Read all about them here: https://t.co/T0QwzfFtq3 https://t.co/qsMTBwwcml

urls.title: This Way Up 2022
urls.description: This Way Up is the UK independent film exhibition sector's go-to event for big picture thinking. In-person delegates will be part of a melting pot of new ideas and industry initiatives. Panels, discussions and other events will be hosted at Dundee Contemporary Arts, with a networking event held at the V & A Museum, Dundee. All delegates will also be able to replay session recordings online. In-person passes cost £135 + VAT. As in 2021, we also offer online-only conference passes. Online delegates will be

tweets.text:
You have just ONE WEEK to get your pass for #ThisWayUp22 before they're going, going...gone! 🎟️⏰

urls.title: SILBERSALZ Science & Media Awards
urls.description: Science provides a creative platform to expand our understanding of the world around us and changes the way we see and experience our world. SILBERSALZ Science & Media Awards, in association with Jackson WILD ™, recognizes and celebrates the achievements of scientists who are working to solve many of today's challenges, of creators who fascinate and inspire audiences worldwide through their stories, advancing the public discussion around global issues. Open to worldwide submissions until 20 January 2023

urls.title: Directors UK - Careers - Doctors: Directors Training Scheme with BBC Studios and Directors UK
urls.description: Doctors is an award-winning continuing drama which entertains a large and diverse audience four times a week. Now, in conjunction with BBC Studios and Directors UK, Doctors is offering a fantastic opportunity for four directors to train as part of its production process. Based in Birmingham, the scheme will take place across one week from 5 - 9 December 2022, and will include talks from directors, cast, producers and other members of the team. The four successful directors will be put through the Doctors

tweets.text:

urls.title: Channel 4 and NFTS Taster Days
urls.description: NFTS/4SKILLS TASTER DAYS The National Film & Television School along with Channel 4’s 4Skills have devised a series of free taster days aimed at those under-represented in the film and television industry to give an overview and suggested pathway to a broad range of careers. There are many roles available in the industry, some you may know, some you may not have considered previously. Each taster day will take a look at one particular area and give you a flavour of what the role entails, what skills are needed, who you work with on a production and how you might begin a career in that field.

tweets.text:
There is still time to sign up for our FREE @channel4skills @nftsfilmtv taster day to find out how to work in #casting for Factual TV

urls.description: Every good television drama starts with the script and script editing is a key part of the process. The script editor helps the writer tell their story so that it best connects with […]

tweets.text: We are hosting an Introduction to Script Editing Workshop that takes you through the steps involved in creating an episode of TV drama✍️. urls.title: BFI NETWORK 1-to-1 with Talent Executive - Film Hub South West
urls.description: Please note that BFI NETWORK South West currently has no short film or feature development funding available.
